alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead; Broadwater; Gallatin; Jefferson; Madison (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 27 at 5:44PM MST until November 27 at 6:45PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Broadwater County in southwestern Montana... Northwestern Madison County in southwestern Montana... North central Beaverhead County in southwestern Montana... Southern Jefferson County in southwestern Montana... Northwestern Gallatin County in south central Montana... * Until 645 PM MST. * At 542 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 10 miles south of Boulder to 9 miles northwest of Silver Star to 9 miles east of Divide to 25 miles east of Wisdom, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Three Forks, Whitehall, Twin Bridges, Pony, Silver Star, Harrison, Melrose, Waterloo, Missouri Headwaters State Park, Glen, Cardwell, Lewis And Clark Caverns State Park and Willow Creek. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
